class.desc:
A sink that provides access to all the events that have been passed to it.

See also ChunkedConversionSink.withCallback.
class.name: convert.AccumulatorSink

methods.desc:
Adds data to the sink.

Must not be called after a call to close.
methods.example:
Implementation

void add(T event) {
  if (_isClosed) {
    throw new StateError("Can't add to a closed sink.");
  }

  _events.add(event);
}
methods.name: add

methods.desc:
Removes all events from events.

This can be used to avoid double-processing events.
methods.name: clear

methods.desc:
Closes the sink.

The add method must not be called after this method.

Calling this method more than once is allowed, but does nothing.
methods.name: close

props.desc: An unmodifiable list of events passed to this sink so far.
props.name: events

class.desc:
A sink that provides access to the concatenated bytes passed to it.

See also ByteConversionSink.withCallback.
class.name: convert.ByteAccumulatorSink

methods.desc:
Adds chunked data to this sink.

This method is also used when converters are used as StreamTransformers.
methods.example:
Implementation

void add(List<int> bytes) {
  if (_isClosed) {
    throw new StateError("Can't add to a closed sink.");
  }

  _buffer.addAll(bytes);
}
methods.name: add

methods.desc:
Adds the next chunk to this.

Adds the bytes defined by start and end-exclusive to this.

If isLast is true closes this.

Contrary to add the given chunk must not be held onto. Once the method returns, it is safe to overwrite the data in it.
methods.example:
Implementation

void addSlice(List<int> chunk, int start, int end, bool isLast) {
  if (_isClosed) {
    throw new StateError("Can't add to a closed sink.");
  }

  _buffer.addAll(chunk, start, end);
  if (isLast) _isClosed = true;
}
methods.name: addSlice

methods.desc:
Removes all bytes from bytes.

This can be used to avoid double-processing data.
methods.name: clear

methods.desc:
Closes the sink.

This signals the end of the chunked conversion. This method is called when converters are used as StreamTransformer's.
methods.name: close

props.desc:
The bytes accumulated so far.

The returned Uint8List is viewing a shared buffer, so it should not be changed and any bytes outside the view should not be accessed.
props.example:
Implementation

Uint8List get bytes => new Uint8List.view(_buffer.buffer, 0, _buffer.length);
props.name: bytes

class.desc:
A codec that converts byte arrays to and from hexadecimal strings, following the Base16 spec.

This should be used via the hex field.
class.name: convert.HexCodec

props.desc:
Returns the decoder of this, converting from T to S.

It may be stateful and should not be reused.
props.name: decoder

props.desc:
Returns the encoder from S to T.

It may be stateful and should not be reused.
props.name: encoder

class.desc:
A converter that decodes hexadecimal strings into byte arrays.

Because two hexadecimal digits correspond to a single byte, this will throw a FormatException if given an odd-length string. It will also throw a FormatException if given a string containing non-hexadecimal code units.
class.name: convert.HexDecoder

methods.desc: Converts input and returns the result of the conversion.
methods.example:
Implementation

List<int> convert(String string) {
  if (!string.length.isEven) {
    throw new FormatException(
        "Invalid input length, must be even.", string, string.length);
  }

  var bytes = new Uint8List(string.length ~/ 2);
  _decode(string.codeUnits, 0, string.length, bytes, 0);
  return bytes;
}
methods.name: convert

methods.desc:
Starts a chunked conversion.

The returned sink serves as input for the long-running conversion. The given sink serves as output.
methods.name: startChunkedConversion

class.desc:
A converter that encodes byte arrays into hexadecimal strings.

This will throw a RangeError if the byte array has any digits that don't fit in the gamut of a byte.
class.name: convert.HexEncoder

methods.desc: Converts input and returns the result of the conversion.
methods.name: convert

methods.desc:
Starts a chunked conversion.

The returned sink serves as input for the long-running conversion. The given sink serves as output.
methods.name: startChunkedConversion

class.desc:
A Codec that performs the identity conversion (changing nothing) in both directions.

The identity codec passes input directly to output in both directions. This class can be used as a base when combining multiple codecs, because fusing the identity codec with any other codec gives the other codec back.

Note, that when fused with another Codec the identity codec disppears.
class.name: convert.IdentityCodec

methods.desc:
Fuse with an other codec.

Fusing with the identify converter is a no-op, so this always return other.
methods.example:
Implementation

Codec<T, R> fuse<R>(Codec<T, R> other) => other;
methods.name: fuse

props.desc:
Returns the decoder of this, converting from T to S.

It may be stateful and should not be reused.
props.example:
Implementation

Converter<T, T> get decoder => new _IdentityConverter<T>();
props.name: decoder

props.desc:
Returns the encoder from S to T.

It may be stateful and should not be reused.
props.example:
Implementation

Converter<T, T> get encoder => new _IdentityConverter<T>();
props.name: encoder

class.desc:
A codec that converts byte arrays to and from percent-encoded (also known as URL-encoded) strings according to RFC 3986.

encoder encodes all bytes other than ASCII letters, decimal digits, or one of -._~. This matches the behavior of Uri.encodeQueryComponent except that it doesn't encode 0x20 bytes to the + character.

To be maximally flexible, decoder will decode any percent-encoded byte and will allow any non-percent-encoded byte other than %. By default, it interprets + as 0x2B rather than 0x20 as emitted by Uri.encodeQueryComponent.
class.name: convert.PercentCodec

props.desc:
Returns the decoder of this, converting from T to S.

It may be stateful and should not be reused.
props.name: decoder

props.desc:
Returns the encoder from S to T.

It may be stateful and should not be reused.
props.name: encoder

class.desc:
A converter that decodes percent-encoded strings into byte arrays.

To be maximally flexible, this will decode any percent-encoded byte and will allow any non-percent-encoded byte other than %. By default, it interprets + as 0x2B rather than 0x20 as emitted by Uri.encodeQueryComponent.

This will throw a FormatException if the input string has an incomplete percent-encoding, or if it contains non-ASCII code units.
class.name: convert.PercentDecoder

methods.desc: Converts input and returns the result of the conversion.
methods.example:
Implementation

List<int> convert(String string) {
  var buffer = new Uint8Buffer();
  var lastDigit = _decode(string.codeUnits, 0, string.length, buffer);

  if (lastDigit != null) {
    throw new FormatException(
        "Input ended with incomplete encoded byte.", string, string.length);
  }

  return buffer.buffer.asUint8List(0, buffer.length);
}
methods.name: convert

methods.desc:
Starts a chunked conversion.

The returned sink serves as input for the long-running conversion. The given sink serves as output.
methods.name: startChunkedConversion

class.desc:
A converter that encodes byte arrays into percent-encoded strings.

encoder encodes all bytes other than ASCII letters, decimal digits, or one of -._~. This matches the behavior of Uri.encodeQueryComponent except that it doesn't encode 0x20 bytes to the + character.

This will throw a RangeError if the byte array has any digits that don't fit in the gamut of a byte.
class.name: convert.PercentEncoder

methods.desc: Converts input and returns the result of the conversion.
methods.name: convert

methods.desc:
Starts a chunked conversion.

The returned sink serves as input for the long-running conversion. The given sink serves as output.
methods.name: startChunkedConversion

class.desc:
A sink that provides access to the concatenated strings passed to it.

See also StringConversionSink.withCallback.
class.name: convert.StringAccumulatorSink

methods.desc:
Adds chunked data to this sink.

This method is also used when converters are used as StreamTransformers.
methods.example:
Implementation

void add(String chunk) {
  if (_isClosed) {
    throw new StateError("Can't add to a closed sink.");
  }

  _buffer.write(chunk);
}
methods.name: add

methods.desc:
Adds the next chunk to this.

Adds the substring defined by start and end-exclusive to this.

If isLast is true closes this.
methods.example:
Implementation

void addSlice(String chunk, int start, int end, bool isLast) {
  if (_isClosed) {
    throw new StateError("Can't add to a closed sink.");
  }

  _buffer.write(chunk.substring(start, end));
  if (isLast) _isClosed = true;
}
methods.name: addSlice

methods.desc:
Empties string.

This can be used to avoid double-processing data.
methods.name: clear

methods.desc:
Closes the sink.

This signals the end of the chunked conversion. This method is called when converters are used as StreamTransformer's.
methods.name: close
